A 22-year-old woman inhales as much air as possible and exhales as much air as she can, producing the spirogram shown in the figure. A residual volume of 1.0 liter is determined using the helium dilution technique. What is her FRC (in liters)?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option (B. 2.5) Explanation: This value does not correspond to any standard lung volume or capacity directly derivable from the given data. It might arise from misreading the graph or incorrect calculation.
  • • Option (D. 3.5) Explanation: This value appears to be the end-inspiratory level of a normal tidal breath (3.0 L + 0.5 L tidal volume), or the peak of the normal tidal breathing, not the FRC. FRC is the volume remaining after a normal expiration, which is 3.0 L in this case.

A V.D. specialist saw a young man suffering from syphilis about to enter a public bath. The specialist tried to dissuade the person from entering the bath, but he refused. The physician reported the matter to the attendant who did not allow the young man to bathe. The patient brought a suit against the doctor for breach of professional secrecy.

options.label: A
options.text: The doctor is guilty of Serious professional misconduct

options.label: B
options.text: The doctor is punishable by court for negligence

options.label: C
options.text: The doctor is not guilty of Infamous conduct

options.label: D
options.text: Doctor is legally correct but ethically incorrect in disclosing the secret of patient

questions.correct_answer: C. The doctor is not guilty of Infamous conduct
